body:
I have tried sending data in this connection, but strangely it didn't fail even though the connection has not been _accepted_  by the server. Running `netstat -an` prints an `ESTABLISHED` connection in only one direction:

```
127.0.0.1.43168      127.0.0.1.9123       32975      0 1048576      0 ESTABLISHED <---- these 2 are from the 1st connection that is already established
127.0.0.1.9123       127.0.0.1.43168      1055200      0 1055220      0 ESTABLISHED
127.0.0.1.53054      127.0.0.1.9123       1055200      0 1048576      0 CLOSE_WAIT <---- from the previously closed connection
127.0.0.1.49280      127.0.0.1.9123       32975      0 1055220      0 ESTABLISHED <---- from these last connection
```

Yes, I had already tried something similar but moving the `uv_close` after the `uv_tcp_init` so the last fd was reused and it worked, but I wasn't sure if it changed the purpose of the test.
If you consider the change valid I can send a PR. Thanks

I _think_ it still tests what it's supposed to test (adding a new file descriptor with the same value as one that's just been removed shouldn't produce events on the old handle) but now it reuses the server's file descriptor instead of one of the client connections.  Maybe @indutny can comment, he's the original author.

If it's not a good fix, I suggest we simply ditch the test.  It tests its invariants very implicitly; simple changes to libuv's event loop implementation would invalidate it.  Such tests are usually more trouble than they're worth.

issue.title: test: fix tcp_close_accept flakiness on SmartOS
issue.body:
This test is failing from time to time on `SmartOS` because
the last connection sometimes succeeds. To avoid it, close
the server before attemping the connection.

Fixes: https://github.com/libuv/libuv/issues/799

body: @bnoordhuis I believe your description is correct.
Ok. I had misread @bnoordhuis comment. His proposed change also fixes the test. I'll close my PR.
So, should we close this then?
No, the test is still flaky, but applying the patch proposed by @bnoordhuis should fix it

Fixed by https://github.com/libuv/libuv/commit/4b58985370cd6aa13f10b390b7694e891abff974 that implements the solution proposed in https://github.com/libuv/libuv/issues/799#issuecomment-204658185 by @bnoordhuis
